  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

          display: block;

          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            star_border
          <i class="material-icons" role="presentation">

      <style>

class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://gmail.com"><!---->https://gmail.com<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<span class="line"><!----> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<!----></span>http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf"><!---->http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Repro Steps<span class="line"><!---->Repro Steps<!----></span><br>macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<span class="line"><!---->macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<!----></span><br>Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <!----></span><br><br>Impact : <span class="line"><!---->Impact : <!----></span><br>Victim will believe file download is from gmail<span class="line"><!---->Victim will believe file download is from gmail<!----></span><br><br>Remediation :<span class="line"><!---->Remediation :<!----></span><br>Show download sources URL origin in prompt<span class="line"><!---->Show download sources URL origin in prompt<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in New Chrome Version<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in           UI>Browser>Downloads

        Thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<!----></a> has 2 bugs:<span class="line"><!----> has 2 bugs:<!----></span><br>1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<span class="line"><!---->1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<!----></span><br>2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<!----></span><br><br>Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<span class="line"><!---->Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>

      <div class="issue-diff">

        I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<!----></span><br><br>1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <span class="line"><!---->1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <!----></span><br>2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<span class="line"><!---->2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>googIe.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://googIe.com"><!---->googIe.com<!----></a> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<span class="line"><!----> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<!----></span><br>3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<span class="line"><!---->3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<!----></span><br><br>I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<span class="line"><!---->I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <!----></span><br><br>Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <span class="line"><!---->Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <!----></span><br>This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <span class="line"><!---->This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <!----></span><br>To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <span class="line"><!---->To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <!----></span><br><br>The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<span class="line"><!---->The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {

  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);

    font-weight: bold;

    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }

    filter: brightness(95%);

  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }

    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {

    padding: 0;

    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }

    text-decoration: none;

    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

          <slot></slot>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      This code when clicked, will open a new tab to the website "<span class="line"><!---->This code when clicked, will open a new tab to the website "<!----></span>https://gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://gmail.com"><!---->https://gmail.com<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<span class="line"><!----> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<!----></span>http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf"><!---->http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Repro Steps<span class="line"><!---->Repro Steps<!----></span><br>macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<span class="line"><!---->macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<!----></span><br>Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <!----></span><br><br>Impact : <span class="line"><!---->Impact : <!----></span><br>Victim will believe file download is from gmail<span class="line"><!---->Victim will believe file download is from gmail<!----></span><br><br>Remediation :<span class="line"><!---->Remediation :<!----></span><br>Show download sources URL origin in prompt<span class="line"><!---->Show download sources URL origin in prompt<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in New Chrome Version<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in New Chrome Version<!----></span><br><br>Video POC : <span class="line"><!---->Video POC : <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PdHT8JibyAsfnWPm0jdXTFGEt7AvJ2GR/view?usp=sharing<a         Thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<!----></a> has 2 bugs:<span class="line"><!----> has 2 bugs:<!----></span><br>1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<span class="line"><!---->1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<!----></span><br>2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<!----></span><br><br>Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<span class="line"><!---->Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<!----></span><br><br>1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <span class="line"><!---->1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <!----></span><br>2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<span class="line"><!---->2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>googIe.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://googIe.com"><!---->googIe.com<!----></a> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<span class="line"><!----> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<!----></span><br>3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<span class="line"><!---->3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<!----></span><br><br>I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<span class="line"><!---->I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <!----></span><br><br>Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <span class="line"><!---->Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <!----></span><br>This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <span class="line"><!---->This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <!----></span><br>To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <span class="line"><!---->To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <!----></span><br><br>The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<span class="line"><!---->The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }

    <mr-issue-page><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);

          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }

            position: static;
          }

            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

            Got it
          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

            Issue 1404593: The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1404593: The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      alisy...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/1140932032" title="alisy...@gmail.com"><!---->alisy...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      alisy...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->alisy...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, Jan 2, 2023, 3:27 PM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 2, 2023, 3:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          <small class="byline">

            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 2, 2023, 3:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1404593: The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          </h1>
          <small class="byline">
            Reported by
            <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on <chops-timestamp title="Mon, Jan 2, 2023, 3:27 PM EST"></chops-timestamp>
            
          </small>
        </div>
      <div class="main-text-outer">
        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1404593: The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          </h1>

      This code when clicked, will open a new tab to the website "<span class="line"><!---->This code when clicked, will open a new tab to the website "<!----></span>https://gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://gmail.com"><!---->https://gmail.com<!----></a>"<span class="line"><!---->"<!----></span> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<span class="line"><!----> and will also trigger a download of the file located at "<!----></span>http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf"><!---->http://URL/Data_From_Gmail.pdf<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span><br><br>Repro Steps<span class="line"><!---->Repro Steps<!----></span><br>macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<span class="line"><!---->macOS Mojave  : 10.14.6 (18G9323)<!----></span><br>Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <span class="line"><!---->Chrome is up to date Version : 108.0.5359.124 (Official Build) (x86_64) <!----></span><br><br>Impact : <span class="line"><!---->Impact : <!----></span><br>Victim will believe file download is from gmail<span class="line"><!---->Victim will believe file download is from gmail<!----></span><br><br>Remediation :<span class="line"><!---->Remediation :<!----></span><br>Show download sources URL origin in prompt<span class="line"><!---->Show download sources URL origin in prompt<!----></span><br><br>This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in New Chrome Version<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability like issue CVE-2021-21133 but this new methode and execute in New Chrome Version<!----></span><br><br>Video POC : <span class="line"><!---->Video POC : <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PdHT8JibyAsfnWPm0jdXTFGEt7AvJ2GR/view?usp=sharing<a         Thanks for the report.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for the report.<!----></span><br><br>https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9"><!---->https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1157743#c9<!----></a> has 2 bugs:<span class="line"><!----> has 2 bugs:<!----></span><br>1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<span class="line"><!---->1. The download page showed the wrong origin.<!----></span><br>2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<span class="line"><!---->2. The download was coming from a page that was no longer loaded.<!----></span><br><br>Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<span class="line"><!---->Here instead we have a background tab initiating a download, which is not a surprising behaviour. The downloads page should show where the download is from, and the tab is loaded. I don't think this is spoofing, but let me ask our security UX folks what they think.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<span class="line"><!---->I don't think this is spoofing, more likely a spam. And this is a well known issue.<!----></span><br><br>1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <span class="line"><!---->1. Show download origin in prompt doesn't work, because prompt doesn't always show as it is related to settings and other stuffs. <!----></span><br>2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<span class="line"><!---->2. Other than opening a new page, spammers can just use sites like<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>googIe.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://googIe.com"><!---->googIe.com<!----></a> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<span class="line"><!----> (a capitalized "I"), and in that case showing the origin will not work well either.<!----></span><br>3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<span class="line"><!---->3. I don't think showing a download only when getting back to the js page is a good idea. If user don't get back to the js page, he will never notice the download and thus a dangerous download can do more damage silently.  Also, it won't handle the case of opening a page in current tab and trigger a download at the same time.<!----></span><br><br>I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<span class="line"><!---->I believe we have UX discussions in the past on what to show on the downloads page on Android. For desktop, the download shelf has limited space and is being replaced soon, so adding xinghuilu@ for ideas on download bubble.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <span class="line"><!---->Thank you for the report, OP. And thank you for tagging me in xinghuilu@ <!----></span><br><br>Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <span class="line"><!---->Features, and any issues that does not result in security implications to a user, are not eligible for VRP rewards. <!----></span><br>This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <span class="line"><!---->This does not look like a security UI spoof, but this does potentially look like a case of unclear security UX. I'd like us to be able to evaluate this issue in full when it is resolved. <!----></span><br>To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <span class="line"><!---->To that end, and in any case, I have re-added the "external_security_report" label to this issue. Any issue reported from an external reporter through the security workflow retains this label and it should not be removed, even if the issue is decided to be a bug or feature. We use this label for tracking purposes and metrics. This will also allow this issue to go through the VRP assessment workflow once the issue is closed as fixed. <!----></span><br><br>The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<span class="line"><!---->The TL;DR == non-security issues are not VRP eligible but we do evaluate all issues once they are resolved. And we will make that determination at that time.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          (was: Security: Chrome Browser Spoofing URL to Download File )
          <br>
        
          Owner:<strong><!---->Owner:</strong>
          
          chlily@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          The origin of the download can be unclear in the download bubble UI
          (was: Security: Chrome Browser Spoofing URL to Download File )
          <br>

        for LitElement.

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;

            border: 0;
          }
